content.title: Superficial Femoral Artery Anatomy
content.description: The major arterial conduit of the thigh, continuation of CFA, and the most common site of symptomatic atherosclerotic occlusive disease.
content.course: Runs through adductor (Hunter's) canal in anteromedial thigh
content.termination: Becomes popliteal artery as it passes through adductor hiatus

disease_predilection.collateral: Profunda femoris reconstitutes popliteal via genicular network

content.statement: Superficial Femoral Artery Anatomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Anatomy Lower-Extremity that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Superficial Femoral Artery Anatomy helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Superficial Femoral Artery Anatomy include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Superficial Femoral Artery Anatomy.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Superficial Femoral Artery Anatomy. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
